definition:
Ferritin is a universal
intracellular protein that stores &%Iron and releases it in a controlled
fashion. The protein is produced by almost all living &%Organisms,
including archaea, bacteria, algae, higher plants, and animals. It is
the primary intracellular iron-storage protein in both prokaryotes and
eukaryotes, keeping iron in a soluble and non-toxic form. In humans,
it acts as a buffer against iron deficiency and iron overload. [from
Wikipedia]
